description: a(0) = 13; for n > 0, a(n) is the greatest prime factor of PreviousPrime(a(n-1))*a(n-1)-1 where PreviousPrime(prime(k))=prime(k-1).
author: _Yasutoshi Kohmoto_
extensions: More terms from Kok Seng Chua (chuaks(AT)ihpc.nus.edu.sg), May 23 2000. a(19) and a(20) pass the strong pseudoprime test for many bases.
